article.headline: Drexel 77, Fairfield 69
article.story: PHILADELPHIA -- Samme Givens led Drexel with team highs of 31 points and nine rebounds as the Dragons beat Fairfield 77-69 on Wednesday night, extending their season-best winning streak to five games. Frantz Massenat added 11 points for the Dragons (7-4), who outrebounded the Stags 28-22 and forced 10 Fairfield turnovers in the win. Three different Dragons had at least two steals apiece. Drexel kept in control nearly the entire way, taking a 38-33 advantage into the break and outscoring the Stags 39-36 in the second half to hold on for the win. The teams were close in shooting performance, but Drexel's 22 of 27 free throws (81.5 percent) were a big advantage over Fairfield's 10 of 13 outing (76.9 percent). Rakim Sanders scored 17 points to lead the Stags (7-6), who have now posted consecutive losses three times this season.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
